metadata.title: CVE-2015-8858 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The uglify-js package before 2.6.0 for Node.js allows attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input in a parse call, aka a "regular expression denial of service (ReDoS)."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2015-8858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-uglify - 2.8.29-3
node-uglify - 2.8.29-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: uglifyjs package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.29-3').
